content.body: With regards to https://github.com/tc39/proposal-pipeline-operator/issues/91#issuecomment-1193358142……can someone confirm that `<>`, without any tag name, actually means something in JSX?
content.formatted_body: With regards to https://github.com/tc39/proposal-pipeline-operator/issues/91#issuecomment-1193358142……can someone confirm that <>, without any tag name, actually means something in JSX?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: With regards to https://github.com/tc39/proposal-pipeline-operator/issues/91#issuecomment-1193358142……can someone confirm that `<>`, without any tag name, actually means something in JSX?
With regards to https://github.com/tc39/proposal-pipeline-operator/issues/91#issuecomment-1193358142……can someone confirm that <>, without any tag name, actually means something in JSX?

content.body: jschoi: Can confirm. It transpiles down to something along the lines of `React.createElement(React.Fragment, ...)`. Here is the react docs page: https://reactjs.org/docs/fragments.html#short-syntax.
content.formatted_body: jschoi: Can confirm. It transpiles down to something along the lines of React.createElement(React.Fragment, ...). Here is the react docs page: https://reactjs.org/docs/fragments.html#short-syntax.

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: jschoi: Can confirm. It transpiles down to something along the lines of `React.createElement(React.Fragment, ...)`. Here is the react docs page: https://reactjs.org/docs/fragments.html#short-syntax.
jschoi: Can confirm. It transpiles down to something along the lines of React.createElement(React.Fragment, ...). Here is the react docs page: https://reactjs.org/docs/fragments.html#short-syntax.

content.body: `<>` is the start of a JSX fragment, with `</>` marking the end of a fragment.
content.formatted_body: <> is the start of a JSX fragment, with </> marking the end of a fragment.
